chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) [Modifiers: General Alcohol Concentration Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: General Alcohol Concentration Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: General Alcohol Concentration Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: General Alcohol Concentration Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Otis B O'Claire was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: General Alcohol Concentration Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

- Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

- Complete an AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety.

- Provide a DNA sample.
- Complete a mental health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment.
- Complete grief counseling.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Otis B O'Claire

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Otis B O'Claire in court, in custody.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Otis B O'Claire.  Prosecuting attorney Erika Strebel in court for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1.  

Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered Count 2 DISMISSED as a matter of law.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 3 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 4 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 2 YEARS, credit for 168 days time served. The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 YEAR, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION/PROBATION:
- Serve 6 months condition time in the House of Correction with Huber privileges for work.
- Provide a DNA sample. 
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
- Complete a mental health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment.
- Complete grief counseling. 
- Complete 60 hours of community service. 
- Court ordered defendant's driving privileges REVOKED for 24 months.  
- Defendant to install the ignition interlock device for 24 months on any vehicle owned, operated, and titled in the defendant's name.
- Complete an AODA assessment, Intoxicated Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan, and comply with any recommended treatment.

- Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*Court orders a fine of $1,800.00
*Court sets restitution at $1,959.94 payable to E.V.
*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
 *Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Otis B O'Claire in court, in custody.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Otis B O'Claire.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. HEARING HELD OFF THE RECORD. Attorney Toran requesting an adjournment. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Otis B O'Claire not in court, in custody.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court via zoom for Otis B O'Claire.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court will accept defendants pending matters for resolution. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court, defendant Otis B O'Claire not in court, in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense does not have an offer and requests another scheduling conference.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Otis B O'Claire in court with Attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Otis B O'Claire in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer N. Beckett. Court took judicial notice of the defendants 3 prior OWI convictions and 21CF4650.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.   
All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 316 Safety Bldg.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  Court ordered SCRAM bracelet to monitor the Defendant maintains absolute sobriety.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Otis B O'Claire in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Otis B O'Claire in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.   Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 4. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.
  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
